result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Paul Burkhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety.
Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Take medications.
Comply with sex offender registry laws. Pay supervision fees.
Seek and maintain fulltime employment. Cognitive Behavior Therapy. Vocational/educational training.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge. Defendant to pay DNA surcharge and all other costs and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: No good time credit. Court stayed sentence to be used as sanctions. Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation; 45 days STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation; 60 days STRAIGHT time for 3rd violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 4th violation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Paul Burkhardt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
Effective date:  05-222-2014                 Initials:  AAC

Defendant Robert Paul Burkhardt in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Robert Paul Burkhardt in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections not made.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 49 days time served.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:
*Defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction.  No good time credit.  Court stayed sentence to be used as sanctions.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days STRAIGHT time for 1st violation; 45 days STRAIGHT time for 2nd violation; 60 days STRAIGHT time for 3rd violation and balance as STRAIGHT time for 4th violation.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Take medications
*Comply with sex offender registry laws
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay supervision fees.

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharge.
Defendant to pay DNA surcharge and all other costs and surcharges during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until civil rights have been restored.

Filed,
-Notice of Right  to Seek Postconviction Relief.
-signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
jad

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Robert Paul Burkhardt not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing hearing in Branch 10.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Paul Burkhardt in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Megan Carmody for Jennifer L. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Robert Paul Burkhardt in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Robert Paul Burkhardt in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
